description: Extract Schedule E rental property income for non-subject property analysis
prompt:
You are a mortgage underwriting assistant. Analyze this Schedule E (Supplemental Income and Loss) and extract the rental property data into the JSON structure below for the FIRST property listed. Be precise with dollar amounts. If a field is not present or blank, use 0.

Return ONLY valid JSON, no commentary:

{
  "taxYear": "number — the tax year on the form",
  "propertyAddress": "string — property address from Part I, or null",
  "rentsReceived": "number — Line 3 (Rents received)",
  "royaltiesReceived": "number — Line 4 (Royalties received), 0 if blank",
  "amortization": "number — amortization or casualty loss amount (from attached statements or Line 19), 0 if blank",
  "totalExpenses": "number — Line 20 (Total expenses)",
  "depreciation": "number — Line 18 (Depreciation expense or depletion)",
  "insurance": "number — Line 9 (Insurance), 0 if blank",
  "mortgageInterest": "number — Line 12 (Mortgage interest paid), 0 if blank",
  "taxes": "number — Line 16 (Taxes), 0 if blank",
  "totalIncome": "number — Line 21 (net), for doc card display"
}

Important rules:
- taxYear is critical — find it in the form header
- Extract data for the FIRST property only (Column A in Part I)
- Rents (Line 3) and Royalties (Line 4) are income items
- Total expenses (Line 20) is the total of all expense items — this is SUBTRACTED
- Lines 9, 12, 16, 18 are individual expenses that are ADDED BACK (they are part of Line 20 total)
- Amortization may appear in attached statements — if not visible, use 0
- Do NOT confuse Part I (rental real estate) with Part II (partnerships/S-corps)
